page.title: 06St. Pauls Parish Church
page.content: Mr.Bryce the church warden told us about the Church.The church was built in 1862-63 in an early English style dedicated to St.Paul.The Bishop of Durham & the Crown are the patrons of the church.The 1st vicar of St.Pauls Church was Charles Edward Palmer.On the 29th of December 1907 there was a fire at the church which almost desroyed it.It was rebuilt and reopened on the 23rd of March 1909.A feature of the church is its peculiarly shaped roof.It is shaped like the bottom of a boat and lined with wood.The stained glass windows at the front of the church show pictures of Jesus sowing seeds,knocking at a door and guarding sheep.The organ which is in the church was built by Brindly and Foster of Sheffield.It was originally put into St.Peebles church in Scotland and then sold to St.Pauls.
